meanings.definition: To move to a new position
meanings.sent1: She repositions her chair closer to the window.
meanings.sent2: He repositions the books on the shelf to make space.
meanings.sent3: The cat repositions itself on the sunny spot on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The dancer repositions her body gracefully like a swan.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle piece repositions perfectly to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: To change the position of something
meanings.sent1: He carefully repositions the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic repositions the engine for better access.
meanings.sent3: The robot repositions the toy car in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The wind repositions the leaves on the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The artist repositions the colors on the canvas to create harmony.

meanings.definition: To adjust the position of an object
meanings.sent1: She repositions the mirror to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: He repositions the camera to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The chef repositions the ingredients on the cutting board.
meanings.sent4: The sun repositions itself behind the clouds at dusk.
meanings.sent5: The teacher repositions the desks for group work activities.
